sentences.en: A jawlike appendage of an arthropod.
sentences.cn: 包括在节肢动物一族;小蜂科之蜂.

sentences.en: After their work, the calculus was no longer an appendage and extension of Greek geometry.
sentences.cn: 经过他们的工作, 微积分不再是古希腊几何的附庸和延展.

sentences.en: An insect appendage consists typically of a limb base and a shaft.
sentences.cn: 昆虫典型的附肢包括肢基体和干.

sentences.en: And Ziqi You must, self - contained finishes atrial appendage.
sentences.cn: 及兹契幽绝, 自足荡心耳.

sentences.en: Macmillan must have loathed being judged as a mere appendage to domestic politics.
sentences.cn: 麦克米伦肯定极不喜欢只被当成国内政治的附属品。

sentences.en: May not be said to be a product, because we are their parents appendage.
sentences.cn: 也许不能说是产物, 因为我们都是父母的附属物.

sentences.en: Most agricultural crops are bred for their seed, seed appendage, or fruit.
sentences.cn: 大多数农作物的育种是为了种子, 种子附属物, 或果实.

sentences.en: Results: Left atrial appendage of 22 patients was adequately visualized by live three - dimensional echocardiography.
sentences.cn: 结果: 22例患者用实时三维探头均可观察到左心耳形态.

sentences.en: Sebaceous gland is an important appendage of skin.
sentences.cn: 皮脂腺是皮肤重要的附属器.

sentences.en: She likes children, a nursery before work, after become an appendage.
sentences.cn: 她喜欢孩子, 之前在一所幼儿园工作, 之后成为附庸.

sentences.en: TEE detected that left atrial guide wire entered left atrial appendage in 4 patients.
sentences.cn: TEE发现4例患者左房钢丝一过性进入左心耳,及时撤出.

sentences.en: The amendment is an appendage of that contract.
sentences.cn: 这个修改是那个合同的附件.

sentences.en: The elephant's trunk is a unique form of appendage.
sentences.cn: 象的鼻子是一种独特的附肢.

sentences.en: The remarkable thing was the way he compensated for his missing appendage.
sentences.cn: 真正了不起的是它克服四肢不全的方法.

sentences.en: Upon marriage, a woman automatically lost most of her legal rights and became an appendage of her husband.
sentences.cn: 结婚后，妇女自动失去自己大部分的法律权利，成为丈夫的附属品。

sentences.en: We report a 65 - year - old patient presenting with left atrial appendage thrombus formation.
sentences.cn: 我们报告一例65 岁 病人在左心耳有血栓产生.

trans.tran_cn: 附属物，依附的人，<生>附属器官，附属肢体（如臂、腿、尾等）
trans.tran_en: something that is connected to a larger or more important thing
